paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Objective:** Become familiar with Sentiment Analysis with Spark ML
**File locations:** spark-labs/train/*, spark-labs/test/*
**Successful outcome:** Automated analysis of the sentiment of movie reviews
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis

---

msg.data:
About

Objective: Become familiar with Sentiment Analysis with Spark ML
File locations: spark-labs/train/, spark-labs/test/
Successful outcome: Automated analysis of the sentiment of movie reviews
Before you begin:
Related lessons: Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis

paragraphs.title: Import libraries
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.sql.functions import lit
from pyspark.sql.functions import regexp_replace
from pyspark.ml import Pipeline
from sparknlp.annotator import *
from sparknlp.common import *
from sparknlp.base import *
import nltk
from nltk.sentiment.vader import SentimentIntensityAnalyzer
from pyspark.sql.types import DoubleType
from pyspark.sql.functions import when
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import MulticlassClassificationEvaluator as MCE
from pyspark.ml.feature import VectorAssembler
from pyspark.ml.pipeline import Pipeline
from pyspark.ml.classification import RandomForestClassifier, GBTClassifier, LogisticRegression

paragraphs.title: 3 - Label the Data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

negative_train_labeled = negative_train.withColumn('label',lit(0))
positive_train_labeled = positive_train.withColumn('label',lit(1))

negative_test_labeled = negative_test.withColumn('label',lit(0))
positive_test_labeled = positive_test.withColumn('label',lit(1))

paragraphs.title: 5 - Clean the data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark train = train.withColumn('text', regexp_replace("value",'
','')) test = test.withColumn('text', regexp_replace("value",'
',''))

paragraphs.title: 6 - Split the Reviews into Sentences
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

documentAssembler = DocumentAssembler().setInputCol("text").setOutputCol("document")
sentenceDetector = SentenceDetector().setInputCols(["document"]).setOutputCol("sentence")
finisher = Finisher().setInputCols(["sentence"]).setOutputAsArray(True) 
sentence_pipe = Pipeline(
    stages = [
    documentAssembler,
    sentenceDetector,
    finisher
  ])

model = sentence_pipe.fit(train)
test_split = model.transform(test)
z.show(test_split)

paragraphs.title: 8 - Create a Sentiment Intensity Analyzer object
11 - Create a function to calculate the sentiment of a row
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

def get_sentiment_score(row):
    total = 0
    for sent in row:
        sentiment_score = sid.polarity_scores(sent)
        total += sentiment_score['pos']-sentiment_score['neg']
    return total

paragraphs.title: 12 - Make a UDF out of it
13 - Use the get_sentiment_score on the finished sentences

paragraphs.title: 15 - Evaluate the accuracy of our predictions

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Use text embeddings
### Convert the test and training data to embeddings

The following code has been used to generate the imdb_train.csv and imdb_test.csv that we will use in this part of the demo.

```python
embed = hub.Module("https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3")
negative_train_embed = embed(negative_train)
positive_train_embed = embed(positive_train)
negative_test_embed  = embed(negative_test)
positive_test_embed  = embed(positive_test)

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
    sess.run(tf.tables_initializer())

    negative_train_embeddings = sess.run(negative_train_embed)
    positive_train_embeddings = sess.run(positive_train_embed)
    negative_test_embeddings = sess.run(negative_test_embed)
    positive_test_embeddings = sess.run(positive_test_embed)
    
    X_train = np.concatenate((negative_train_embeddings, positive_train_embeddings), axis=0)
    y_train = [0 for x in negative_train_embeddings] + [1 for x in positive_train_embeddings]
        
    X_test = np.concatenate((negative_train_embeddings, positive_test_embeddings), axis=0)
    y_test = [0 for x in negative_test_embeddings] + [1 for x in positive_test_embeddings]
    
```

The execution takes more than 3 hours so we saved the result.

paragraphs.title: 16 - Read in the Data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

train = spark.read.format('csv').option('inferSchema',True).load('spark-labs/imdb_train.csv')
train = train.withColumnRenamed('_c512','label')

test = spark.read.format('csv').option('inferSchema',True).load('spark-labs/imdb_test.csv')
test = test.withColumnRenamed('_c512','label')

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 17 - Create the features vector
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

features_list = ['_c%d' % x for x in range(512) ]
assembler = VectorAssembler(inputCols = features_list, outputCol='features')

paragraphs.title: 18 - Create new predictions using embeddings
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

gbt = GBTClassifier(maxDepth=10,maxIter=40)
p = Pipeline(stages=[assembler,gbt])
model = p.fit(train)
predictions2 = model.transform(test)

paragraphs.title: 19 - Evaluate the accuracy of this new model

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have successfully seen how to perform sentiment analysis using Spark.

---

3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
